alert.note: Alert for Eastern Alaska Range (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued December 30 at 2:20PM AKST until January 02 at 3:00PM AKST by NWS Fairbanks
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM LATE FRIDAY NIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Blizzard conditions possible. North winds gusting as high as 65 mph could result in whiteout conditions in blowing and drifting snow. Dangerously cold wind chills to 60 below are also possible. Plan on very difficult to impossible travel conditions. * WHERE...Eastern Alaska Range south of Black Rapids. * WHEN...From late Friday night through Sunday afternoon. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Strong north winds gusting as high as 65 mph could cause areas of blowing and drifting snow and near whiteout conditions at times. Cold wind chills as low as 60 below zero could cause frostbite in as little as 10 minutes to exposed skin. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... A Winter Storm Watch means there is potential for significant snow, sleet or ice accumulations that may impact travel. Continue to monitor the latest forecasts.
